basics.name: Ivan Lomeli
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Swarthmore College Class of 2019 graduate. Computer science major seeking full-time employment in the greater Southern California area.

courses: Computer Vision, Database Management Systems*, Animations*, Machine Learning Fundamentals, Adaptive Robotics*, Computer Networks*, Software Engineering*, Data Structures and Algorithms*, Computer Systems*, Linear Algebra , Discrete Mathematics, Engineering Methodology*, Single Variable Calculus, Mechanics*, Electrical Circuit Analysis* (* denotes lab component)

work.summary: Engaged in theory and practice of digital scholarship through hands-on experience with web development & design, digital media, text analysis, and data visualization. Automated the process of obtaining and maintaining Domain Validated SSL certificate for McCabe Library infrastructure.
Operated lathe and milling machinery to produce parts for outsourced clients (ie: SpaceX). Analyzed production parts for quality using precision measuring tools (caliper and laser based).

Interned under the Central Recordâ€™s department of a top international law firm that specializes in the areas of Intellectual Property Law, Employment law, Real State, and many others. Managed case files through record-keeping software used to track and maintain files from all global locations. Awarded the top-tier monetary scholarship of excellence award.

volunteer.summary: Host weekly practices and organize seasonal games.
Designed and delivered workshops that developed students' capabilities to carry out effective social media strategies of engagement, awareness raising, marketing, advertising, & storytelling.

volunteer.position: Chair of Student Life '16-'17, Chair of Student Outreach '17-'18
volunteer.summary: Evaluate campus concerns and work towards long-term policy solutions
Sought funding opportunities for student developers on campus. Managed yearly budget, allocating funds to student projects deemed worthwhile by LaunchDeck board.
Developed organization and time management skills by balancing academics and varsity athletics. Commit over 25 hours each week. Acquired experience performing in high pressure situations.

awards.title: Aurora Camacho de Schmidt Scholar Activism Recognition Award
awards.summary: This award honors outstanding scholarly work that interrogates social justice, equity, and community principles espoused by the Swarthmore Intercultural Center. Recipient demonstrates engagement of praxis to connect theoretical frameworks and social justice practice.

awards.title: Philip H. Barley '66 Memorial Scholarship
awards.summary: The scholarship provides financial assistance for a junior or senior who has demonstrated outstanding leadership qualities at Swarthmore College.

awards.title: Richard Rubin Scholar
awards.summary: The Richard Rubin Scholar Program awards eligible students of high academic performance mentorship and intern opportunities to advance their scholastic, inter-personal, social and professional success at Swarthmore College and beyond.
